keyword: how many calories in spaghetti pasta
title: How Many Calories in Spaghetti Pasta?
meta_description: Learn how many calories in spaghetti pasta—about 371 kcal per 100g dry—plus carbs, protein, fat, and full nutrition details for easy tracking.
h1: How Many Calories in Spaghetti Pasta?
assumptions: Dry, uncooked spaghetti made from durum wheat semolina; standard commercial variety, no added salt, oil, or flavors.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, wheat type, enrichment, and portion size; dry vs. cooked weights differ significantly. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100g of dry spaghetti pasta provides ~371 kcal, mostly from carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tbsp olive oil when cooking (per 100 g dry)
Cooked plain (boiled; values for equivalent dry weight)

faqs.q: How many calories in 100g of dry spaghetti pasta?
What are the carbs in spaghetti pasta?
faqs.a: About 75g carbs per 100g dry, with 3.1g fiber.

faqs.q: Does cooking change calories in spaghetti pasta?
faqs.a: Calories per dry weight stay the same, but cooked pasta (100g dry yields ~250g) has ~158 kcal per 100g cooked due to water absorption.

faqs.q: How much protein in spaghetti pasta?
Is spaghetti pasta low in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, only 1.5g total fat per 100g dry, with minimal saturated fat.
